itemDescription: English rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: James Peters (7 August 1879  – 26 March 1954) was an English rugby union player and, later, a rugby league footballer. He is notable as the first black man to play rugby union for England, and the only black England player until 1988.

response: | 1906 || England play South Africa (known as the Springboks) in rugby union for the first time. James Peters is withdrawn from the England squad after the South Africans objected to playing against a black player.
| 1906 ||  James Peters becomes the first black person to play rugby union for England, against Scotland.
* Jack Peters (James Peters), English football player
